# Source: https://www.electronjs.org/docs/latest/tutorial/tray

On this page

# Tray Menu

This guide will take you through the process of creating an icon with its own context menu to the system tray.

- On macOS, the icon will be located on the top right corner of your screen in the [menu bar extras](https://developer.apple.com/design/human-interface-guidelines/the-menu-bar#Menu-bar-extras) area.
- On Windows, the icon will be located in the [notification area](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/shell/notification-area) at the end of the taskbar.
- On Linux, the location of the Tray will differ based on your desktop environment.

## Creating a Tray icon[â€‹](#creating-a-tray-icon "Direct link to Creating a Tray icon") 

The tray icon for your Electron app needs to be created programmatically with an instance of the [Tray](/docs/latest/api/tray#new-trayimage-guid) class. The class constructor requires a single instance of a [NativeImage](/docs/latest/api/native-image#class-nativeimage) or a path to a compatible icon file.

[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]note

File formats vary per operating system. For more details, see the [Platform Considerations](/docs/latest/api/tray#platform-considerations) section of the Tray API documentation.

## Minimizing to tray[â€‹](#minimizing-to-tray "Direct link to Minimizing to tray") 

In order to keep the app and the system tray icon alive even when all windows are closed, you need to have a listener for the [`window-all-closed`](/docs/latest/api/app#event-window-all-closed) event on the `app` module. The base Electron templates generally listen for this event but quit the app on Windows and Linux to emulate standard OS behavior.

Setting up minimize to tray

``` 
app.on('window-all-closed', () => )
```

## Attaching a context menu[â€‹](#attaching-a-context-menu "Direct link to Attaching a context menu") 

You can attach a context menu to the Tray object by passing in a [Menu](/docs/latest/api/menu) instance into the [`tray.setContextMenu`](/docs/latest/api/tray#traysetcontextmenumenu) function.

[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]note

Unlike with regular [context menus](/docs/latest/tutorial/context-menu), Tray context menus don\'t need to be manually instrumented using the `menu.popup` API. Instead, the Tray object handles click events for you (although various click-related events exist on the API for advanced use cases).

Creating a Tray menu that can quit the app

``` 
const  = require('electron/common')
const  = require('electron/main')

// save a reference to the Tray object globally to avoid garbage collection
let tray

// 16x16 red circle data URL
const icon = nativeImage.createFromDataURL('data:image/png;base64,')

// The Tray can only be instantiated after the 'ready' event is fired
app.whenReady().then(() => 
  ])
  tray.setContextMenu(contextMenu)
})
```

[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]tip

To learn more about crafting menus in Electron, see the [Menus](/docs/latest/tutorial/menus#building-menus) guide.

[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]warning

The `enabled` and `visibility` properties are not available for top-level menu items in the tray on macOS.

## Runnable Fiddle demo[â€‹](#runnable-fiddle-demo "Direct link to Runnable Fiddle demo") 

Below is a runnable example of attaching various menu items to the Tray\'s context menu that help control app state and interact with the Tray API itself.

[][][]

[docs/fiddles/menus/tray-menu (39.2.4)](https://github.com/electron/electron/tree/v39.2.4/docs/fiddles/menus/tray-menu)[Open in Fiddle](https://fiddle.electronjs.org/launch?target=electron/v39.2.4/docs/fiddles/menus/tray-menu)

- main.js
- index.html

``` 
const  = require('electron/main')
const  = require('electron/common')

// save a reference to the Tray object globally to avoid garbage collection
let tray = null

function createWindow () 

// The Tray object can only be instantiated after the 'ready' event is fired
app.whenReady().then(() =>  else 
      }
    },
    ) => 
    },
    ) => 
    },
    
  ])

  tray.setContextMenu(contextMenu)
})

app.on('window-all-closed', function () )

app.on('activate', function () )
```

``` 
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
  <head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <!-- https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/CSP -->
    <meta http-equiv="Content-Security-Policy" content="default-src 'self'; script-src 'self'">
    <title>Tray Menu Demo</title>
  </head>
  <body>
    <h1>Tray Menu Demo</h1>
    <p>This app will stay running even after all windows are closed.</p>
    <ul>
      <li>Use the "Open App" menu item to focus the main window (or open one if it does not exist).</li>
      <li>Change between red and green Tray icons with the "Set Green Icon" checkbox.</li>
      <li>Give the Tray icon a title using the "Set Title" checkbox.</li>
      <li>Quit the app using the "Quit" menu item.</li>
    </ul>
  </body>
</html>
```
